articles.headline: Dispelling a Myth
articles.summary: A newspaper investigation revealed that suburban schools in Oregon, touted as excellent, are actually mediocre. The series utilized regression analyses to isolate school performance from the advantages of student backgrounds, challenging the belief in their world-class status.

articles.headline: A New Wrinkle
articles.summary: A high-profile investigation discovered criminal activities by teachers, including a coach accused of sexual harassment, highlighting the inefficiencies and backlog of cases in the Texas teacher licensing board.

articles.headline: Law Creates Shortage
articles.summary: California faced a teacher shortage due to legislation reducing class sizes. The investigation highlighted the resulting dependence on underqualified teachers in low-income areas.

articles.headline: Teacher, Student Exodus
articles.summary: An analysis of Akron's public schools revealed severe educational inequities, with high teacher turnover and pervasive poverty affecting schools' performance, driving students and families away.
